title: 10 Free Colorado Brewery Tours (Samples Included)
text:
By Nina Snyder Updated August 01, 2016 . 
Celebrate the more than 200 brews crafted in Colorado with a round-up of free brewery tours across the state, from Fat Tire in Fort Collins, Colo., to MillerCoors in Denver. All tours are free, and many offer samples to visitors 21-and-up. 1. Anheuser-Busch 
More than 94,000 people tour the Anheuser-Busch brewery in Fort Collins each year, despite Colorado's origins as Coors country. The brewery offers free tours 10 a.m. - 4 p.m. Thursday - Monday, and daily during June - September. Visitors age 21-and-up can partake of samples, and all visitors can visit the Clydesdale Hamlet onsite. 
Anheuser-Busch BreweryFort Collins, CO 80524 More Â» 
continue reading below our video Beware! The 5 Most Common Travel Scams 2. Avery Brewing 
Avery Brewing in Boulder offers free tours of its brewery at 4 p.m. on Monday - Friday, and 2 p.m. on the weekends. No reservations are necessary for the tours, and the tap room also offers food, as well as live music on Thursdays and Sundays. Established in 1993, Avery Brewing crafts Avery IPA and Ellie's Brown, as well as seasonal brews such as Karma Ale (it is Boulder, after all.) 
Avery Brewing
